707977f-a.title: Manhattan: 2nd Avenue - 124th Street (East)
707977f-a.text:
(1)
Second Ave., east side, between East 125th (left), and 124th Streets,
showing the bridge approach. Buildings, of which the rears are shown,
face on the north side of East 124th Street, east of Second Ave. Over- I
head is the Second Ave. Elevated line.
August 3, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, north from East 124th Street, showing work completed.
Structures shown on the extreme left, of which the rears are shown, face ]  on East 126th Street.
May 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REF ODUCTIONS.

715303f-a.text:

frame structure.

P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722946f-b.title: Manhattan: 124th Street (West) - 2nd Avenue
722946f-b.text:
(1)
Riverside Park: A northwestward view of the Claremont Inn from
Riverside Drive (foreground) at West 124th Street. The gas holder seen
is between 132nd and 133rd Streets.
February 1914.
Walter L. Bogert.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The Port Lee Ferry at the foot of West 125th and 130th Streets,
as viewed northward from a point slightly west of the Inn seen in
No. 1. Note the wintery appearance of the Hudson River and the
Palisades on the Jersey coast.
February 1914.
Walter L. Bogert.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707972f-a.text:

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
